cyclone.name: SALLY
cyclone.current_location: about 165 miles southeast of Biloxi, Mississippi
cyclone.trajectory: Slowly moving west-northwest toward the Louisiana coast, expected to turn north and then northeast across Alabama and Georgia toward the southern Appalachians late in the period
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeastern Louisiana / Mississippi coast (near the LA-MS border)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch: Mississippi/Alabama border to Alabama/Florida border; Tropical Storm Watch: Indian Pass FL to Ochlockonee River FL
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning: Morgan City LA to Mississippi/Alabama border; Tropical Storm Warning: Mississippi/Alabama border to Indian Pass FL; Storm-surge Warning: Port Fourchon LA to the Alabama/Florida border including Mobile Bay
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from Louisiana to the western Florida Panhandle; inland track across AL-GA-TN
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions with occasional gusts 25–35 mph possible Thursday as the remnant low passes inland to the west
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the South Carolina coast from Sally
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of heavy rain 2–4 inches possible Thu–Fri with locally higher amounts
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes cannot be ruled out across SC as the remnant circulation moves northeastward
